I hate the industry use of the phrase "post-relational databases," as if relational was some sort of a premature phase.  LOL, recommend you watch Stonebraker's talk from 2012, which is event more relevant today (https://lnkd.in/dWFQuWi 40+ years of db research lead to advances in relational storage, they started with same NoSQL stores back in the 70s.  NoSQL has its place, but relational models and databases are still the best general purpose storage mechanisms for structured data.  And yes, you can scale them, even prematurely :-)
